title: Nordics and Baltics Cloud and Service Provider Solution Center Leader
description:
Job Description:
**Join Our Team as a Nordics and Baltics Cloud and Service Provider Solution Center Leader**  

In this role, you will lead the project execution team for the multi-business-unit projects in the Cloud and Service Provider segments with a focus on Secure Power. You’ll be building and empowering a high-performing team to deliver innovative solutions for complex Data Centre projects. You’ll work closely with customers and stakeholders, ensuring seamless execution, exceptional customer satisfaction, and strong collaboration across global teams.  

You will drive the tendering team that support our sales forces to provide the best value added solution to our customers.  

If you’re passionate about leadership, strategic impact, and shaping the future of critical infrastructure, this is your opportunity to make a difference!  

You can be based in one of our HQ’s in the Nordics – Stockholm, Oslo, Espoo or Copenhagen.  

**What drives us at Schneider Electric?**  

For us, impact isn’t just a term paraded across posters or social media; it’s encoded into our culture. After all, Schneider makes companies, infrastructure, buildings, homes, data centers, and entire industries more efficient and sustainable. With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the energy transition the planet urgently needs. There’s a reason why we’re consistently ranked among the most sustainable companies in the world. Here, you can pursue your dream career while actively making a long-term, positive impact on the planet.
With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the energy transition the planet urgently needs. What’s more, we help tens of millions of people in underserved communities gain access to energy and education — so you’re making the world a fairer place, too. You’ll sit among colleagues with vastly different personal and professional backgrounds, all united by a vision of a better world.

 **What you’ll do**
* Drive alignment with the Secure Power Commercial Strategy by providing visionary leadership, building an engaged and high-performing organization, and developing a clear roadmap to ensure the right competencies across all stages of the Data Centre lifecycle.
* Ensure timely and compliant implementation of all system business solutions secured by the Nordic & Baltic business in the cloud and service provider segment delivering exceptional customer satisfaction through close collaboration with key stakeholders.
* Engage directly with customers on the most complex projects, representing the full Data Centre opportunity—including Schneider Electric hardware, software, services, and relevant third-party solutions.
* Foster seamless collaboration between Country-Cluster Application Center teams and key stakeholders across Countries, Zones, Regions, Segments, Businesses, Global Solutions, and Strategic Accounts.
* Lead efficient resource management during project execution, ensuring adherence to best practices, governance, and tools, while managing team delivery from both technical and commercial perspectives.
* Support the Nordic Baltic Zone CS&P segment lead during country cadence calls to define and follow up on action plans for key opportunities, and contribute at the sales stage by assessing project timelines and resource planning.
* Proactively manage solution business risks during execution, ensuring accurate risk coverage and mitigation, with a strong focus on effective implementation of contract, claim, and change order management processes for the Cloud and Service Provider segment.

**Essential for the Role*** Extensive experience in building engaged and collaborative teams and guiding them to achieve ambitious goals and deliver exceptional results.
* Suitable educational background such as degree in Engineering, Business, or related field
* Robust network and understanding of the Nordic Baltic Cloud & service provider market landscape with an understanding of Data Centre design and concepts for the infrastructure layer
* Strategic thinking, with the ability to drive initiatives from concept to implementation
* Great communication and interpersonal skills
* Proactive and dynamic approach to business development
* Passionate about building networks and tailoring offers to customer requirements
* Effective communication skills in English, with excellent verbal, written, and presentation abilities.

 **Why Schneider Electric?**  

  

**Flexibility:** With our Global Flexibility at Work policy, and our hybrid work model, we empower our employees for their work-life integration.**Career Development**: We provide a rich environment for our people to grow and learn every day through our career development model.**Good Benefits**: Schneider Electric offers a robust benefits package to support our employees such as paid family leave, a culture of wellness and much more.**Inclusive Environment**: We build a culture of respect where everyone feels safe to be their authentic selves. We are fully committed to inclusion, and our policies and culture reflect this commitment **So, what’s Next?**  

If you’re ready to take on a high-impact role in a dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help us shape the future of industrial project management. **Where can I find out more?**  

About Schneider Electric: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbldHPFltQQ  

We are proudly #1 in the World’s Most Sustainable Corporation 2025  

#LI-EJ1

  


About Our Company: **Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**


When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values – Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork – starts with us.


IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.


We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.


Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric – apply today!


€36 billion global revenue  

+13% organic growth  

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries  

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

  

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. *Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.*  

*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter* *here*  

  

*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: L2 SOC Analyst - Stockholm
description:
Level 2 SOC Analyst


Title: Level 2 SOC Analyst


Location: Kista, Stockholm, on site


Job type: Full-Time Permanent


Salary: Negotiable / DOE  



**About Us**

  

  

Integrity360 is the largest independent cyber security provider in Europe, with a growing international presence spanning the UK, Ireland, mainland Europe, Africa and the Caribbean. With over 700 employees, across 12 locations, and six Security Operations Centres (SOCs)—including locations in Dublin, Sofia, Stockholm, Madrid, Rome and Cape Town—we support more than 2,500 clients across a wide range of industries.  



  

  

Over 80% of our team are technical experts, focused on helping clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats in an ever-evolving cyber landscape. Our security-first approach positions cyber resilience as a business enabler, empowering organisations to operate with confidence.  



  

  

At Integrity360, people come first. We invest heavily in learning, development and progression, fostering a dynamic culture where innovation, collaboration and continuous growth are at the heart of what we do. If you're ready to take your cyber security career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you.  



  

  

**Job Role / Responsibilities**

  

  

As a **L2** **SOC Analyst** , you will act as a core investigator responsible for deep-dive analysis, incident ownership, and advanced threat handling. You will mentor L1 SOC analysts within the team.


This role is part of a dedicated SOC team , providing analysts with the opportunity to operate within a highly mature security environment, gain exposure to advanced technologies and complex threat scenarios, and develop deep domain expertise in financial services security operations.  



  

  

**Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**

* Lead **investigation** of confirmed an d high-risk security incidents
* Perform **deep-dive analysis** using:
	+ Microsoft Sentinel
	+ Microsoft Defender Suite
	+ Trellix
	+ Zscaler
* Apply **threat intelligence** and attacker **TTP** analysis using:
	+ MITRE ATT&CK
	+ Cyber Kill Chain
	+ NIST IR Lifecycle
* Produce **high-quality incident reports** with actionable recommendations
* Coordinate **containment** and **remediation** actions with engineering, infrastructure, and client teams
* Provide technical **guidance** and **mentorship** to Tier 1 analysts
* Participate in **continuous improvement** of SOC processes, playbooks, and detection quality
* Maintain exceptional **communication** with client stakeholders during active incidents
Perform ad-hoc analysis of varied logs, identifying anomalies in customer environments.  
* 

  

  

**Desired Skills**

* Minimum **1 year experience** in a SOC Tier 1 or security analyst role
* Advanced investigative and analytical capability
* Strong understanding of modern attack techniques, threat actors, and detection methodologies
* Proven experience with SIEM, EDR/XDR, identity, email and cloud security tooling
* Excellent technical documentation and communication skills
* Ability to manage multiple complex incidents simultaneously
* Ability to perform event correlation, host/ network threat analysis.
Ability to manage multiple incidents and make effective decisions under high pressure environment.  
* 

  

**Certifications/Qualifications (preferred but not required)**

* Security industry certifications: SEC+, CYSA+, Net+, SC-200,AZ-500,AZ-900,Splunk Power user
* A working knowledge of Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), SIEM, SOAR & DLP is a nice to have.
Experience working with threat hunting tools is nice to have.  
*

Integrity360 is the largest independent cyber security provider in Europe, with a growing international presence spanning the UK, Ireland, mainland Europe, Africa and the Caribbean. At Integrity360, people come first. title: Presales Solutions Architect
description:
### **Impact Frends Growth Journey**


At Frends iPaaS, we are dedicated to redefining the future of integrations and automation. Our mission is to make integrations fast, easy, and transparent.

**We are on the lookout for a new Presales Solutions Architect** from Sweden to join our centralized Solutions Architects team. If you enjoy working with a Nordic iPaaS leader and global challenger, working at high speed, and driving growth with great people in a low-hierarchy culture, our role could be ideal for you.

**Frends iPaaS is** a modern European, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers across various industries, including both private and public sectors. Frends is recognized 3rd year in the **Gartner***®* **Magic Quadrant™** for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends is also awarded in **G2 review** with the "Momentum Leader (API Management)," "Best Usability," "Easiest to Use & Admin," "Highest User Adoption," "Most Implementable," "Fastest Implementation," and "Fastest Time to Value" badges in 2025. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.

#### **What You´ll Do?**

* Partnering with sales to provide support, guidance and technical leadership to prospective or existing customers with **strong sales engineering** acumen
* Actively taking part in sales to showcase, present, and demonstrate the Frends value, outcomes, and use cases
* Acting as a leading technical expert and trusted advisor in the sales process: technical discovery, value assessments, demos, proof-of-values/pilots, and RFI/RFPs
* Engaging directly with various customer personas (technical and C-level stakeholders)
* Hands-on architecting solutions in various sales cases: mid to enterprise customers
* Helping and guiding customer organizations and development teams to success
* Advocating Frends outcomes and modern integration/automation patterns
* Providing a feedback loop to the Frends product organization
* Participating in events


You can read more about the role on our blog.

#### **We guarantee**

* **Make an Impact:** Affect Frends' growth, shaping success in our strategic region.
* **Career Growth:** Take on a critical new role with continuous learning in a fast-growing company.
* **Nordic Leader, Global Challenger:** Join one of the Nordics' top integration technology organizations with its own platform, Frends.
* **Thriving Integration Field:** Join a vital and growing field of integrations where your skills make a difference—integrations keep the world spinning.
* **Collaborative Culture:** Experience a low-hierarchy, supportive culture built on trust, flexibility, responsibility, and strong team spirit.
* **Work Flexibly:** Enjoy modern, flexible working times and hybrid work from Sweden (office in Stockholm).
* **Competitive Compensation:** Earn a fixed salary with performance-based incentives.

**Read from our** **blog** **why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.**

#### **What You Bring**


The ideal candidate will already have work experience in the iPaaS/SaaS sector in a similar presales role and possess great skills as a customer relations professional.

**We highly value excellent communication skills, a positive and sales-oriented** mindset, a curiosity about learning new technologies, and the ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and growing IT environment. As a person, you are flexible and proactive , and you enjoy cooperation with different stakeholders and new environments. You are interested in understanding customers' needs and businesses, and want to develop and grow them further.

**To succeed in this role,** **we value**

* Experience in sales engineering or presales solutions architecture
* Previous employment in a software company that builds or outsources integrations
* Proven track record in supporting successful sales teams to land new business and meet customer requirements
* Hands-on software or architecture development experience
* History of implementing and using various integration and architectural patterns (e.g. APIs, ETLs, event-driven, AI solutions)
* Strong cloud platforms knowledge

**Location & language: The role requires living in Sweden and fluency in Swedish** as well as professional written and spoken English. Traveling will be required occasionally to meet customers and the team, and to attend events as needed. We support a hybrid work model, but we require visiting our Stockholm office on a monthly basis.

* **Interested in joining Frends?**


We do not expect excellent CVs or application letters, but we hope you will contact us via our application form.

**Additional Information**

* We offer permanent, full-time employment (no consultancy / freelance contracts).
* You will be reporting to the Lead Solution Architect.
* The salary will be a fixed monthly salary plus a bonus model.
* Our recruitment process includes around four discussions. To ensure a smooth and informative process, you will meet at least our People Integrator, Team Lead, team members, and CRO. Demo case and reference checks are included in the process.

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.

**About the job**
-----------------



Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.

  

As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on your customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development, and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day-to-day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.  

  

In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor.  

  

You will travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with support, engineers, and site reliability engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Polar Aerosol Transport
emails: annica.ekman@misu.su.se, sara.engstrom@misu.su.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, sekodirekt@seko.se, sekodirekt@seko.se
description:
**The Department of Meteorology** at Stockholm University (MISU) conducts research and education spanning the atmosphere, ocean and physical climate sciences. We offer educational programmes at the Bachelors, Masters and PhD levels. Our research addresses fundamental questions concerning the dynamics, physics, chemistry and biogeochemistry of the atmosphere and ocean relevant for weather and climate. We study questions originating from the deep ocean to the upper atmosphere and from the tropics to the poles. In this effort, we use and develop theory, statistical methods, and numerical models in close interplay with observations. We also develop and lead observational research using satellite and surface-based measurements, including icebreaker expeditions to the Arctic.  

  

MISU is embedded in a larger research environment including the Bolin Centre for Climate Research, the Baltic Sea Centre, and the Swedish e-Science Research Centre. The department is highly international, with over half our employees coming from outside Sweden. Here you can find more information about the Department of Meteorology.

**Project description**
-----------------------


This project aims to improve our understanding of how aerosols are transported from the midlatitudes to the polar regions, how the aerosols interact with different climate processes, and how these interactions change in a changing climate. The position is associated with a project funded by the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Foundation called “Feedbacks between sea ice, ocean, clouds, and aerosols in changing polar climates (ACCELERATE)”. The overall ambition of ACCELERATE is to deliver more robust future climate projections by providing constraints on global climate models regarding polar cloud feedbacks.

**Main responsibilities**
-------------------------


The main task will be to study aerosol transport to and from the polar regions using the FLEXPART model and other tools.

**Qualification requirements**
------------------------------


In order to qualify for a Postdoctoral position, applicants are required to hold a Swedish doctoral degree or an equivalent relevant degree from another country. The degree must have been completed no later than when the employment decision is made.

**Assessment criteria**
-----------------------


It is considered an advantage if the doctoral degree or an equivalent degree was completed no more than three years prior to the application deadline. Under special circumstances, an older degree may also be an advantage. Special circumstances refer to sick leave, parental leave, elected positions in trade unions, service in the total defense, or other similar circumstances, as well as clinical attachment or service/assignments relevant to the subject area.


The doctoral degree must be in meteorology, atmospheric sciences, oceanography or a related field. In the appointment process, special attention will be given to research skills within the area of the employment. An excellent command of written and spoken English is also required. Experience of using the FLEXPART model to study aerosol transport is considered a merit.

**About the employment**
------------------------


The position involves full-time employment for a minimum of two years and a maximum of three years, with the possibility of extension under special circumstances. Start date 2026-03-01 or as per agreement.


Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.

**Contact**
-----------


Further information about the position can be obtained from Professor Annica Ekman, annica.ekman@misu.su.se.


For information about the recruitment process and terms of employment, please contact Head of Administration Sara Engström, sara.engstrom@misu.su.se.

**Application**
---------------


Apply for the position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.


The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.


Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: Receptionist Scandic Gävle Väst
description:
**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Gävle Väst.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

Do what you love and help us drive change! As a Senior Data Scientist at H&M Group, you’ll turn vast amounts of data into meaningful insights and solutions that make an impact on a global scale. You’ll collaborate closely with business and tech teams to solve complex problems using advanced analytics, modelling, and machine learning.


* Contribute to and potentially lead the short- and long-term data science agenda within a product team
* Collaborate with machine learning and data engineers to design, build, and deploy machine learning products that scale globally
* Help colleagues and stakeholders understand algorithms and decisions made by AI systems
* Explore large, complex data assets to uncover insights that drive business value
* Develop tools and frameworks for common machine learning needs like model traceability, feature reuse, and A/B testing

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**

You’ll join a collaborative, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders. Together, you’ll build innovative AI solutions that support H&M Group’s transformation and create value for millions of customers worldwide.

  



**WHO YOU ARE**

*We are looking for people with…* 

* A degree in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, or a similar field (e.g., machine learning) and a strong desire to keep learning
* Solid foundational knowledge of machine learning and statistics
* Ability to independently implement algorithms and models, contributing to production-level code
* Background in agile environments with strong team collaboration and data-driven development
* Experience working with time series data is beneficial
* Proven ability to work with production-level machine learning systems and solid understanding of optimization problems, including related libraries or solvers

*And people who are…*

* Comfortable working with cloud platforms, like Google Cloud
* Hands-on and eager to understand business needs and turn them into technical solutions
* Always looking for ways to automate and simplify, taking initiative to improve products
* Strong team players who are result-oriented and driven to challenge and innovate

 **WHO WE ARE**

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  



**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* 30 days holiday
* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* H&M Incentive Program
* Wellness benefit 4000kr/year
* Beniflex Benefits Portal
* Community with activities

 **JOIN US**

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.


* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Digital Marknadsförare med Grafisk Design
description:
Vi är ett snabbväxande litet svenskt teknikbolag (omsätter 100 Mkr/år efter 3 år) som sitter i Nordstan/Göteborg. Företaget grundades av 3 st trevliga serieentreprenörer och vi har idag cirka 100 st B2B kunder i 10 länder i norra Europa.
  
Vi söker nu en driven, självständig datadriven digital marknadsförare, som också är en duktig på grafisk design. Ingen teknisk bakgrund krävs.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Performance Marketing / Lead Generation
  
Sökannonsering (Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, etc)
  
Sociala annonser (LinkedIn, Meta, etc.)
  
Skapa vacker och professionell grafik (till hemsida, presentationer, annonser, events, etc)
  
...och säkert mycket mer som vi gemensamt kommer på!
  
  

Om tjänsten
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid.
  
**Anställningsform:** 6 månaders provanställning, därefter tillsvidare.
  
**Lön:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Start:** Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.
  
**Plats:** Hemma och Centrala Göteborg (Nordstan)
  
  

Ansökan
  
Maila ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil till jobs@cloudfamily.com

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior projektledare Supply Chain Order-to-Cash / Infor M3 Cloud
description:
**Senior Projekt-/Programledare**
---------------------------------

**Customer Reliability & Transparency (Order-to-Cash / Infor M3 Cloud)**

### **Om uppdraget**


Vi söker en erfaren **Senior Projekt-/Programledare** för ett strategiskt och verksamhetsnära konsultuppdrag med fokus på **Customer Reliability och Customer Transparency**. Uppdraget innebär att leda ett tvärfunktionellt initiativ inom **Order-to-Cash (O2C)** samt att planera och koordinera övergången från **Infor M3 till Infor M3 Cloud**.


Rollen kombinerar **programledning, ERP-förändring, BI/Analytics och förändringsledning** och genomförs i nära samarbete med Supply, Sales Supply, kundnära funktioner, IT och Finance.

### **Om kunden**


Uppdraget utförs hos ett **internationellt industriföretag** med stark global närvaro och höga krav på **leveransprecision, kundnöjdhet och datadriven styrning**. Verksamheten präglas av komplexa supply chain-flöden, avancerad tillverkning och ett tydligt fokus på digitalisering och standardisering av processer och system.

### **Uppdragsperiod**

* **Start:** 1 februari 2026
* **Slut:** 31 augusti 2026
* **Omfattning:** Heltid
* **Arbetssätt:** Flexibel hybrid/remote
* **Plats:** Sverige
* **Resor:** Vid behov enligt överenskommelse

### **Ansvarsområden**

* Leda och samordna ett tvärfunktionellt program inom Customer Reliability & Transparency
* Driva förbättringar i hela **Order-to-Cash-flödet** (orderläggning, ATP/CTP, leverans, fakturering, reklamation/kredit)
* Planera och koordinera migreringen från **Infor M3 till M3 Cloud**, inklusive integrationer, teststrategi (SIT/UAT), cutover och hypercare
* Säkerställa kravställning, backlog och leverans av **Power BI-rapporter och dashboards** för operativ och ledningsmässig uppföljning
* Förbättra datakvalitet och etablera tydliga mätetal kopplat till kund-, artikel-, pris- och leveransdata
* Ansvara för stakeholder management, styrgrupper, kommunikation och förändringsledning

### **Kvalifikationer (måste-krav)**

* Flerårig erfarenhet som projekt- eller programledare inom Supply Chain och/eller kundnära flöden
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ERP-relaterade förändringar, gärna med **Infor M3 och/eller M3 Cloud**
* Stark förståelse för **Order-to-Cash-processer** och angränsande flöden
* Förmåga att leda seniora intressenter i komplexa matrisorganisationer
* Praktisk erfarenhet av **Power BI** (datamodeller, KPI:er, publicering och förvaltning)
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på **svenska och engelska**, i tal och skrift

### **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet från Regional Supply eller Sales Supply
* Erfarenhet av EDI/PEPPOL, CRM-integrationer, kundportaler och prishantering
* Certifiering inom projektmetodik (PMP, Prince2, SAFe) eller förändringsledning (PROSCI)
* Erfarenhet av datalager/ETL (t.ex. Azure, SSIS) kopplat till Power BI
* Erfarenhet från tillverkningsindustri med höga krav på leveransprecision

title: Data Automation Engineer
description:
Designing, implementing, and maintaining automated workflows for data processing and system orchestration. The role includes defining workflow concepts, integrating with internal and external systems, and ensuring stable, efficient workflow execution.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design workflow concepts, including process mapping and technical solution recommendations.
  
Implement end‑to‑end workflows in a workflow‑orchestration platform.
  
Migrate existing automation pipelines from legacy systems to the new workflow environment.
  
Operate, monitor, and maintain workflow scheduling to ensure reliability and performance.
  
Integrate workflows with APIs, data sources, and other platform components.
  
Provide technical documentation aligned with internal standards.
  
Participate in agile ceremonies, stand‑ups, and regular coordination meetings.
  
Support continuous improvement through structured governance and reporting.
  
  

**Required Competence:**  

Minimum 3 years of experience working with workflow‑orchestration or ETL/ELT tools.
  
Strong Python development skills.
  
Experience integrating with SQL databases, APIs, and cloud‑based services.
  
Familiarity with agile development and CI/CD practices.
  
Ability to produce clear technical documentation in English.
  
Strong analytical skills and ability to understand complex process flows.

title: Associate Program Manager
description:
**Overview** **Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I)** team is responsible for the full lifecycle of Microsoft’s cloud infrastructure, spanning site selection, development, and operations. Our global footprint includes more than 400 datacenters in 34 countries, supported by over 165,000 miles of fiber optic cable. These facilities form the backbone of Microsoft Azure and are central to our commitment to reliable, secure, and sustainable digital infrastructure.


As part of the **CO+I Energy Team**, you will join a team of professionals responsible for sourcing, negotiating, and delivering strategic energy projects. The candidate will manage a portfolio of activities to identify and execute energy opportunities to advance Microsoft’s datacenter growth, in line with strategies to leverage sustainability, time to market and economic value in order to solidify Microsoft’s leadership in providing infrastructure for the global AI economy.


Microsoft Cloud Operations & Innovation seeks a new Program Manager in Energy Markets, focused on the Nordics in the EMEA region (Europe, Middle East, and Africa). The candidate will manage a portfolio of activities to optimize and execute opportunities in datacenter energy supply and technology, including: support site selection efforts, advance datacenter interconnection strategy, develop business cases for new technology applications at the datacenters, communicate project needs, support data management requests, and manage relationships across internal and external stakeholders.


The candidate will have the ability to develop creative solutions that combine knowledge of regulated and deregulated power markets to deliver power to Microsoft datacenters. The candidate will need to understand the dynamics of energy markets and Microsoft’s own unique position in the energy sector. This necessitates that the candidate brings an innovative, collaborative presence to the role towards driving commercial & technology execution to realize business goals, lower costs, and meet sustainability targets.


Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.


In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

 **Responsibilities*** Lead datacenter interconnection development with utilities and third-party energy suppliers in support of Microsoft’s datacenter businesses in EMEA.
* Assist in the analysis of energy industry trends, market policy, and regulations to proactively identify opportunities to reduce cost, minimize risk, and advance sustainability goals.
* Partner with globally distributed internal stakeholders on site selection and energy project development.
* Assist in datacenter metric tracking and process improvement for internal reporting.
* Work collaboratively with external vendors and consultants on regional energy market research, distilling key insights material to Microsoft’s cloud business growth.
* Support internal business cases including providing input on financial models and regional strategies.
* Business travel required (25%, subject to fluctuation with business tempo).

 **Qualifications*** Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Law, Policy, or related field, and junior experience in the energy industry, project management, business development, or related role
* OR Master's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Business, Engineering, Law, Policy
* OR equivalent experience.
* Broad understanding of the European power industry, with specific focus on the mechanics of deregulated power markets.
* Understanding of working within the energy and/or utility industry in Europe.
* Strong commercial and technical analysis capabilities to support review of utility tariffs, power contracts, and power market fundamentals
* Growth mindset with problem-solving skills.
* Fluent in English and a Nordic language (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish)


While not required, we also look for the following**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Law, Policy, or related field, and experience in the energy industry, project management, business development, or related role
* OR Master's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Business, Engineering, Law, Policy, experience in the energy industry, project management, business development, or related role
* OR equivalent experience.
* Experience negotiating power agreements.
* Experience working within the energy and/or utility industry in Europe.

**Background Check Requirements:**


Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:

* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


#COICareers | #EPCCareers | #DCDCareers

  

  

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process**.**
company_description: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

title: Product Manager (Agents)
description:
**About The Role**
 In this role, you own a product area end-to-end. You take initiative to surface and prioritize problems, and you lead work across the entire product lifecycle: from ideation and discovery, to validation and iteration, to scaling adoption, to removing what doesn’t add enough value. You care deeply about what you do–from the details of the product to the people you build with.
   

  

 Sana is a lean product organization, and your job as a PM is to team up with world-class designers and engineers to build agentic AI products that are loved by our users and customers.
   

  

****In this role, you will****
* Build a deep understanding of our customers, users, and market via interviews, studies, and frequent customer interactions
* Analyze and reason about the state of the product via qualitative and quantitative data, and proactively obtain the data you need
* Share your customer knowledge and product judgment with the team to guide decisions with conviction
* Run lean product discovery to prove opportunities before committing to big bets
* Keep product, commercial, and marketing teams aligned on what we’re building, why, when it’s coming, and how it works
* Shape how we position and launch new features, working with marketing to tell a clear story and drive adoption
* Help the team move fast by eliminating roadblocks


****What success looks like****
* You act like an owner and build a product you’re proud to put your signature on
* Features ship fast, are high quality, and drive measurable impact, because you choose a few important problems and say no to the rest
* Your communication is effective, direct, and clear
* End-to-end ownership is the norm—problems are solved, not handed off
* The team has high alignment and low entropy, with everyone pulling in the same direction


****Our tech stack****
 We build on a simple modern stack optimized for both humans and AI:
   

  

* Backend: TypeScript, Node.js
* Frontend: TypeScript, React, Tailwind
* Databases: Postgres, Redis
* Cloud infra: GCP/Kubernetes/Terraform


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary and compensation package
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**Job Description**

**​WHAT YOU’LL DO​**
  

 Do what you love and help us drive change! As a Senior Data Scientist at H&M Group, you’ll turn vast amounts of data into meaningful insights and solutions that make an impact on a global scale. You’ll collaborate closely with business and tech teams to solve complex problems using advanced analytics, modelling, and machine learning.​
   

  




* Contribute to and potentially lead the short- and long-term data science agenda within a product team


* Collaborate with machine learning and data engineers to design, build, and deploy machine learning products that scale globally


* Help colleagues and stakeholders understand algorithms and decisions made by AI systems


* Explore large, complex data assets to uncover insights that drive business value


* Develop tools and frameworks for common machine learning needs like model traceability, feature reuse, and A/B testing



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH​**




 You’ll join a collaborative, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders. Together, you’ll build innovative AI solutions that support H&M Group’s transformation and create value for millions of customers worldwide.
   

  





 ​
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




*We are looking for people with…​*



* ​ A degree in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, or a similar field (e.g., machine learning) and a strong desire to keep learning


* Solid foundational knowledge of machine learning and statistics


* Ability to independently implement algorithms and models, contributing to production-level code


* Background in agile environments with strong team collaboration and data-driven development


* Experience working with time series data is beneficial


* Proven ability to work with production-level machine learning systems and solid understanding of optimization problems, including related libraries or solvers



*And people who are…​*



* Comfortable working with cloud platforms, like Google Cloud


* Hands-on and eager to understand business needs and turn them into technical solutions


* Always looking for ways to automate and simplify, taking initiative to improve products


* Strong team players who are result-oriented and driven to challenge and innovate



  

  





**WHO WE ARE​**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





 ​
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE ​**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. ​
   

  




* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


* ​30 days holiday


* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance


* H&M Incentive Program


* Wellness benefit 4000kr/year


* Beniflex Benefits Portal


* Community with activities



  

  





**JOIN US​**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​

title: Experienced professionals to our Banking & Financial Services Engineering Team
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Are you an experienced Agile Transformation Change Leader or Agile Delivery specialist with a passion for banking? Deloitte AB in Stockholm is looking for talented professionals with 2-5 years of experience to join our team and help drive agile change within the financial services sector.
   

  

  





 In this role, you will be key to accelerating agile transformations and delivering agile projects that empower our banking clients to enhance efficiency, innovation, and business outcomes. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement agile operating models tailored to complex banking environments.
   

  

  





**What You’ll Do**



* Build, test, and implement technology solutions for leading banks and financial institutions.
* Work in Agile delivery teams, supporting iterative development and continuous improvement.
* Drive transformation projects in core banking, payments, cards, lending, compliance, and risk management.
* Collaborate across Deloitte’s Swedish and global practices to deliver future-proofed solutions.
* Act as a bridge between business and technology, contributing to product roadmaps and delivery.
* Ensure that technical solutions meet business needs as well as security and regulatory requirements.


**Qualifications**

**What We Are Looking For:**



* 4-6 years’ experience as a consultant within Business Agility, Agile Transformation Change Leader or Agile Delivery (Agile Project Management) professional within banking
* Strong understanding of agile frameworks and proven experience leading or supporting agile transformations and delivery teams
* Expertise in at least two of the following areas:
	+ Value stream design and agile operating model development
	+ Agile tooling such as JIRA and Confluence, including configuration or migration
	+ Lean Portfolio Management
	+ Agile people management, including agile practices for line organizations
	+ Product Management, including business analysis or product ownership focused on lifecycle and continuous improvement
	+ DevOps and/or agile testing and quality assurance
* Willingness to travel
* You are working and living in Sweden
* Proficiency in Swedish and English and strong communication skills


**Preferred Knowledge:**
* Experience working in core banking domains such as Payments, Lending, Savings, Cards, AML, Risk, Compliance, Trading & Capital Markets or Finance and Regulatory Reporting
* Meriting if you previously held roles within Banking such as Product Owner, Scrum Master, RTE, Coach, Epic Owner or Transformation Lead
* Ability to apply agile principles within regulated and complex banking environments
* Familiar with concepts such as systems/design thinking, dual operating system and Scaled Agile frameworks such as SAFe, Scrum at Scale or Spotify.
* Academic background in behavioral science, engineering or information systems


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to work with Sweden’s largest financial services clients in Agile delivery set-ups.
* A collaborative and inclusive workplace at our Stockholm office, with hybrid flexibility.
* Continuous learning and professional development, including certifications in Agile, cloud, and financial services.
* Competitive compensation and benefits tailored to the Swedish market.
* Clear career growth opportunities within Deloitte’s Financial Services and Engineering practices.


  

  

  


**Ready to Make an Impact?**




 If you’re passionate about engineering, Agile delivery, and product ownership within banking, Deloitte Sweden offers the platform to accelerate your career and shape the future of financial services.
   

  

  




**Additional Information**

**How to Apply:**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role


**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**
  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**

 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition, at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


**About The Job**
 Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.
   

  

 As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on your customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development, and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day-to-day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.
   

  

 In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing yourself as a trusted advisor.
   

  

 You will travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goals, and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple workstreams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with support, engineers, and site reliability engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Data Engineer
description:
GCP Data Engineer - Stockholm
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid - 2-3 days/week in office)
 



**Language:** 
 English (working language)
 



**Salary:** 
 45,000-65,000 SEK/month dependent on experience
 



  





**About the role:** 




 We’re looking for a Data Engineer to help build and evolve a modern, cloud-native data platform powering a large-scale digital consumer product. You’ll join a curious and collaborative in-house team, working close to product, analytics, and business stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.
 



  





 This is a hands-on role with real ownership: from data modelling and pipelines to performance, infrastructure, security, and long-term scalability.
 



  





 What you’ll do
 


* Design, build, and maintain an enterprise data warehouse using dimensional modelling (facts, dimensions, aggregates, star schema).
* Develop and optimize ELT pipelines with a strong focus on reliability, performance, and scalability.
* Ensure best practices around data security, privacy, and data integrity.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into robust data models and analytical solutions.
* Take increasing ownership of key data features and pipelines as you ramp up on the domain, stack, and use cases.



  





 What we’re looking for
 


* Solid experience with data warehousing and ingesting data from multiple sources.
* Strong data modelling skills, including Star Schema and SCD Type II.
* Excellent SQL skills and good working knowledge of Python.
* An analytical mindset and experience building reliable data pipelines for complex problems.
* A collaborative, proactive, and curious team player who balances fast iteration with high quality.
* Good understanding of data integrity, privacy, and governance principles.



  





 Tech stack
 


* **Cloud & Data Warehouse:** 
 Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
* **ELT & Orchestration:** 
 Airflow, dbt, Apache Beam, Dataflow, Cloud Composer
* **Infrastructure & Tooling:** 
 Terraform, Docker, Git, CI/CD
* **Analytics & BI:** 
 Looker Studio, Tableau



  





 Why join us?
 


* High impact role in a fast-growing, product-led company.
* Modern GCP-based data stack with real ownership and influence.
* Supportive, knowledge-sharing culture that values learning and craftsmanship.
* Hybrid setup with strong team connection in a central Stockholm office.
* Competitive benefits package including private healthcare, pension, and wellness allowance.



  





 If you enjoy building scalable data foundations and working closely with product and business teams, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.
* Implement scalable data processing and analytics solutions.



  





**Skills We're Looking For:** 




  




* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.
* Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
* Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple priorities.



  





**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Lösningsarkitekt till IT-Total – Strategen bakom nationell säkerhet
description:
**Vill du designa fundamentet för Sveriges mest kritiska infrastruktur?**
 Vi på IT-Total söker nu en senior Lösningsarkitekt för ett av landets mest betydelsefulla uppdrag inom försvar- och säkerhetsbranschen. I en tid där omvärldsläget ställer extrema krav på motståndskraft, spelar vår verksamhet en avgörande roll. Här får du chansen att visualisera och realisera komplexa miljöer där säkerhet inte är ett tillval – det är utgångspunkten.
   

  

 Rollen: Arkitekten bakom systemet Som arkitekt i detta team är det du som sätter målbilden. Du ansvarar för att definiera hur hela den tekniska miljön ska konstrueras, från de stora penseldragen till de detaljer som säkerställer driftkontinuitet över tid.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Design och struktur: Du definierar zoner, nätverksstrukturer och säkerhetsnivåer för att möta framtidens utmaningar.
* Integration: Du leder arbetet med hur våra miljöer integreras mot externa system på ett säkert och kontrollerat sätt.
* Livscykelhantering: Du fastställer tekniska färdplaner och strategier för hur drift och underhåll ska ske långsiktigt.


 Samverkan Som Gör Skillnad Du Blir Navet i Vår Tekniska Leverans Och Din Förmåga Att Samarbeta Är Avgörande
   

  

* Du arbetar nära vår Cyber Security Specialist för att säkerställa att robusta säkerhetskrav byggs in i arkitekturen från start.
* Du styr Nätverksspecialisterna i hur nät, segmentering och redundans ska utformas enligt din design.
* Du förser den Tekniska Projektledaren med den roadmap och det beslutsunderlag som krävs för ett framgångsrikt genomförande.


 Din Profil Vi Söker Dig Som Har En Djup Teknisk Förståelse Och Erfarenhet Av Att Leda Arkitekturarbete i Komplexa Organisationer. Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har Certifieringar Som Stödjer Din Expertis
   

  

* Arkitektur & Säkerhet: TOGAF, CISSP, CISM eller ISO 27001 Lead.
* Cloud & Metodik: Azure Solutions Architect eller ITIL.


 Krav För Tjänsten (Säkerhetssektorn) Då Du Kommer Att Arbeta Med System Som Är Kritiska För Rikets Säkerhet, Gäller Följande
   

  

* Anställning hos IT-Total: För detta uppdrag kan vi endast erbjuda anställning hos oss på IT-Total. Vi har ej möjlighet att samarbeta med underkonsulter eller egna företagare (AB) i detta specifika projekt.
* Säkerhetsprövning: Svenskt medborgarskap och en godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll är ett krav.


**Bli en del av IT-Total: Där expertis möter gemenskap**
 På IT-Total tror vi på kraften i gemenskap och innovation. Vi föddes ur idén att skapa branschens bästa arbetsplats – en miljö som ger dig glädje, stimulans och utrymme att växa inom det område du brinner för. Som konsult hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: tryggheten i en stabil anställning med goda förmåner, kombinerat med möjligheten att arbeta i teknikens framkant.
   

  

**Varför välja IT-Total?**
 Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar helhjärtat på din framtid och personliga utveckling. Vi ser till att du har rätt verktyg och stöd för att glänsa i din roll, samtidigt som du omges av engagerade kollegor. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med landets mest spännande och samhällskritiska projekt där säkerhet alltid står i fokus.
   

  

**Vårt Unika Fokus På Säkerhet**
* Trygghet & Integritet: Med säkerhetsklassade lokaler och egna datahallar garanterar vi högsta möjliga skydd för våra kunder.
* Expertis: Vi arbetar med ett högt säkerhetstänk i allt vi gör.
* Krav för rollen: Då vi verkar inom säkerhetssektorn är svenskt medborgarskap och en godkänd säkerhetsprövning ett krav för anställning.


 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där din expertis gör skillnad på riktigt. Välkommen till en framtid där vi säkrar Sverige tillsammans.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
   

  

 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
   

  

 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
   

  

 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
   

  

 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
   

  

 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
   

  

 👩🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
   

  

 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
   

  

 🏌️‍♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Cloud Architect
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar – och samtidigt sätta din egen prägel på ett växande företag?* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Azure Cloud Architect hos oss kommer du att designa, implementera och underhålla avancerade Azure-lösningar för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett litet, agilt team där dina idéer och beslut gör verklig skillnad. I rollen får du ett stort ansvar och en central position i att driva Cloudiums utveckling framåt – både tekniskt och strategiskt. Du samarbetar nära kunder och interna team för att skapa lösningar som är både smarta, skalbara och säkra.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




 Har stark teknisk kompetens och entreprenörsanda – du ser möjligheter, tar initiativ och vågar tänka nytt. I ett mindre team trivs du med att ha inflytande och ta ägandeskap över projekt. Som problemlösare hittar du de bästa lösningarna för komplexa utmaningar och navigerar smidigt mellan teknik och kunddialog. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 



  




* Flera års erfarenheter att arbeta med Azure och dess tjänster.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av infrastruktur, scripting, automatisering och/eller utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera molnlösningar inom stora organisationer.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och driva projekt framåt.



  





**Om Cloudium** 




 Med över 35 års samlad erfarenhet inom IT har vi på Cloudium specialiserat oss på infrastruktur, SQL Server och Azure. Vi förstår de utmaningar företag möter vid övergången till molnet och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar som optimerar drift, säkerhet och prestanda. Vårt mål är att leverera exceptionell service och överträffa förväntningar. Med djup expertis och ett kundfokuserat arbetssätt guidar vi dig genom hela processen – från strategi till en effektiv, säker och skalbar molnlösning.
 



  





**Är du vår nästa kollega?** 




 Hos oss får du mer än bara ett jobb – du får en nyckelroll i ett växande företag där dina insatser verkligen gör skillnad. Vi kombinerar teknisk spetskompetens med en innovativ och framåtdrivande kultur där vi vågar testa nytt, utvecklas och ha kul på vägen. Vill du vara med och forma Cloudiums framtid tillsammans med oss?
 



  





**START** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**PLATS** 
 : Stockholm
 



**OMFATTNING** 
 : Heltid
 



**LÖN** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**KONTAKT** 
 : Senior Recruiter Mikaela Ehk mikaela.ehk@oddwork.se (för frågor om tjänsten, ej ansökningar)
 



**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM** 
 : Urval sker löpande

title: Data Engineer
description:
**📊 Data & Analytics Engineer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





*Shape the future of data-driven decision-making in a modernising enterprise* 




  





 A well-established Swedish company is undergoing a major digital transformation and is looking for a
 **Data & Analytics Engineer** 
 to help build and optimise its new cloud-based data platform. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-impact team at the early stages of a long-term data modernisation journey.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full data lifecycle - from ingestion and modelling to orchestration and reporting - using modern tools like DBT, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. The role blends elements of analytics engineering, BI development, and data pipeline optimisation, offering broad exposure and real ownership.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Own and evolve the company’s DBT-based data models, supporting business-critical reporting and analytics
* Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with business users to understand data needs and translate them into scalable models
* Orchestrate and monitor data pipelines using Azure Data Factory
* Optimise Snowflake usage and cost, and contribute to performance tuning
* Support legacy SQL Server-based data flows and help plan their gradual migration to the cloud
* Work closely with a small team to shape the company’s modern BI architecture



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Core** 
 : SQL, DBT, Power BI, Snowflake
* **Cloud & Orchestration** 
 : Azure, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage
* **Other** 
 : Python (for light scripting), Git, Medallion architecture (Bronze/Silver/Gold)



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong SQL skills and experience with data modelling and transformation
* Familiarity with DBT or a strong interest in learning it
* Experience building reports in Power BI or similar tools
* Understanding of data orchestration and pipeline monitoring (e.g., ADF, Airflow)
* Ability to work across both backend and frontend data layers
